skill.name: scientific-writing
skill.description: Core skill for the deep research and writing tool. Write scientific manuscripts in full paragraphs (never bullet points). Use two-stage process: (1) create section outlines with key points using research-lookup, (2) convert to flowing prose. IMRAD structure, citations (APA/AMA/Vancouver), figures/tables, reporting guidelines (CONSORT/STROBE/PRISMA), for research papers and journal submissions.

security_audit.summary: No executable code, file access, or network actions were found. Content is instructional text with citation and guideline references only.

content.user_title: Draft scientific papers with structured guidance
content.value_statement: Scientific manuscripts are hard to structure and format consistently. This skill guides IMRAD sections, citations, and reporting standards in clear prose.
actual_capabilities: Guide IMRAD section structure and flow
Provide citation format guidance for APA, AMA, Vancouver, Chicago, and IEEE
Apply reporting guideline checklists such as CONSORT, STROBE, and PRISMA
Advise on figures and tables selection and design
Convert outlines into full paragraph prose using a two-stage process
limitations: Does not perform literature searches without the research-lookup skill
Does not generate figures without the scientific-schematics skill
Does not validate statistical analyses or raw data
Does not submit manuscripts to journals

use_cases.title: Structure a thesis article
use_cases.description: Turn draft notes into a full IMRAD manuscript with clear section guidance.

use_cases.title: Prepare a trial report
use_cases.description: Apply CONSORT guidance and citation style to a clinical study paper.

use_cases.title: Improve clarity and style
use_cases.description: Refine wording and consistency to match journal expectations.

prompt_templates.title: Plan an IMRAD outline
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an IMRAD outline for a study on sleep and cognition, listing key points and needed citations.

prompt_templates.title: Draft an introduction
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a two-paragraph Introduction on AI in radiology with APA-style in-text citations placeholders.

prompt_templates.title: Apply reporting checklist
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my Methods section for STROBE completeness and list missing items.

prompt_templates.title: Revise for journal style
prompt_templates.prompt: Rewrite this Discussion to match a clinical journal tone and improve clarity without changing meaning.

output_examples.input: Rewrite this Results section for clarity and integrate figure references.
output: Rewritten Results in full paragraphs with smooth transitions
Figure references added where findings are presented
Statistics stated with effect sizes and confidence intervals

best_practices: Provide target journal and citation style up front
Share a brief outline or key points before drafting prose
State study type so the correct reporting guideline is used
anti_patterns: Requesting final manuscripts as bullet lists
Asking for citations without specifying style
Omitting study design details needed for methods guidance

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, the guidance is model-agnostic and works across Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides writing guidance only and does not fetch sources or verify data.

faq.question: Can it integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Yes, it pairs with research-lookup for sources and scientific-schematics for figures.

faq.question: Does it access my files or credentials?
faq.answer: No, it does not read files or access credentials.

faq.question: What if my output lacks flow or clarity?
faq.answer: Provide the target section and audience, and request a revision for clarity and coherence.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic writing helpers?
faq.answer: It focuses on IMRAD structure, scientific style, citations, and reporting guidelines.
